data.title: Malformed indent guides
data.body:
![indent-guides](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2766036/10861319/82b8c54c-7f51-11e5-8954-91af714a00d9.png)
Notice how the final indent guide on each blank line is ever so slightly misaligned with the rest.  Re-opening the file or reloading Atom does not fix the issue.

Atom 1.3.0-dev-69dfdd0, Windows 10 x64, safe mode.

/cc @nathansobo @as-cii

2. CMD+O to open a folder. I have a reactjs project that was working as intended yesterday, and with no code changes atom now crashes. Very odd.

**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.3
**Thrown From**: Atom Core

data.title: Cursor bug after upgrading to OSX el capitan
data.body:
My cursor is now 1 character off to the right of where it's supposed to be, immediately after upgrading to OSX 10.11.1 "El Capitan"; I've disabled all community plugins and still see the bug, but opening in `atom --safe` shows the cursor working as normal. I have no linked packages, no dev packages, no errors in developer tools, nothing of note in `config.cson`. 

Any ideas?

![atom-cursor-bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/199718/10858482/c5ef0950-7f2b-11e5-80c9-bae68f00e491.gif)

data.title: Focus pane items async, improve tab responsiveness
data.body:
The native `focus` call is the bulk of the time spent in response to
an active item change event. By debouncing the event and always focusing
asynchronously (async is the default for `debounce` callbacks), tab
changing is more responsive because the 'tabs' package typically updates
its UI only after the native `focus` call completes.

For the crazy perf test of pressing and holding next/previous tab
(ctrl-tab on OS X), many unnecessary `focus` calls are avoided because
of debouncing.

data.title: Wrong command names shown after installing shell commands in Atom Beta
data.body:
When you install the shell commands in Atom Beta, the confirmation message says, "The shell commands `atom` and `apm` are installed." It should instead say, "The shell commands `atom-beta` and `apm-beta` are installed."

To reproduce this issue, choose "Atom" in the menu bar, and then choose "Install Shell Commands".
#### Screenshot

![screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2988/10857572/7924d454-7f14-11e5-8263-6376a7bc7088.png)
#### Version info

Atom version: 1.2.0-beta0
OS version: OS X 10.11.1

data.title: Saving a write protected file freezes Atom
data.body:
OS X: 10.11.1
Atom: 1.1.0

Saving a write protected file, in this case a config file located in /etc, freezes Atom. The menu bar is still usable though. I can select Atom > Quit and after a few seconds I get an "Editor is not responding" dialog box.

Saving these files did not freeze Atom prior to today's 1.1.0 release but it did make the cursor disappear as reported in #9340.

data.title: Caret positioning is incorrect in Atom 1.1 - does not land correctly on first character
data.body: I excitedly installed Atom 1.1 - which seems a lot faster - but now I paid the price for early adopting because the caret seems messed up and is confusing when editing a file. I have included a little screen grab and associated shot showing the cursor position read out in the footer. GitHub rejected my .mov attachment so here is posted on S3: http://fhda.s3.amazonaws.com/atom-1.1-cursor-bug.mov And the screenshot showing the cursor position to be "5:1" but graphically the caret is 1 or 1.5 steps forward. Thanks!

data.title: AST-based language support (syntax highlighting, linting, etc)
data.body:
One of the new things out with [Babel 6](https://babeljs.io/blog/2015/10/29/6.0.0/) is a vision of it's use in tools like Atom for syntax highlighting, linting, code completion, and other language-dependent features.

Atom, as I understand it, leverages TextMate grammars.  While this has been a great way to get instant support for a wide ecosystem of languages, it depends on regular expressions, which can have bad performance edge cases.  For example, any time I happen to load a large minified JavaScript file in Atom, it effectively freezes.

Perhaps if there was support for some mechanism within Atom that would take an AST generated by something like Babel 6, transform or parse that into a language-agnostic form, and use that for language-specific interactions within Atom (e.g. markers for syntax highlighting), we could get much better performance, and be able to leverage a growing ecosystem of AST parsers.

data.title: [MAC] Project Folders lost after crashes and force quits
data.body:
If Atom 1.1.0 crashes, or is force quitted on a Mac, all project folders will be lost for me. I've been able to reproduce this since 1.0.0.

This is related to the issue described in #9643

Is this a known issue?

data.body: On Windows, when I use the ctrl-/ shortcut for toggle-line-comments in .sce files, the line / block is commented using `/*...*/` which is not recognized by scilab. It used to work fine and used `//` instead.

data.title: no plugin preview - maybe proxy reason?
data.body:
Hey,

I am using atom on Windows 7 and am sitting behind a corporate proxy.

I already configured my %USERHOME%/.atom/.apmrc to have
http_proxy = foo
https_proxy = foo

and if I want to install plugins that is working pretty fine.

But what is not working is that I can't have a look on the preview/information of a plugin.
After some time of loading I get:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8200750/10844969/59c10f0c-7f04-11e5-9404-4c81887c644c.png)

And I also have broken icon images on Install setttings:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8200750/10844978/677b05ee-7f04-11e5-8f98-c77057a30dd9.png)

Am I missing anything?

Regards,
Stefan

data.title: Line numbers don't line up in gutter with ProggyTiny font
data.body:
I'm trying to use the [ProggyTiny](http://www.proggyfonts.net/download/) font with Atom.

It's a bitmap font, i.e. designed to be viewed at a certain size. When I set the size to `16` (the only size where it looks right - I usually need to use `12` with other applications), the line spacing is much too big:

![atom_1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/625793/10842484/33e71248-7ef2-11e5-9c13-038a162f77c5.png)

When setting the line spacing to `1.0` instead of the default `1.5`, the line numbers start to act funny:

![atom_2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/625793/10842500/640fe56c-7ef2-11e5-9f52-33fb7c270bba.png)

It's even worse with `0.8`:

![atom_3 png](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/625793/10842520/87256fe0-7ef2-11e5-8ca8-2f8529045203.png)

This is with Atom 1.0.19 on Debian Jessie, and I see this with the default themes (tried "Atom Dark" and "One Dark").

data.title: Cursor position problem
data.body:
After the 1.1 upgrade I've a great problem with cursor position. It's not in the right position when I write.

I use Linux, Fedora 23

data.title: Swedish letters sorted wrong in the folder/file-sidebar
data.body:
The swedish letters `Å`, `Ä` and `Ö` are placed last in the alphabet. The sorting in atom treats them as `a` and `o`, i think.

![https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/hze1a285agokxrc/2015-10-30%20at%2008.46.png?dl=0](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/hze1a285agokxrc/2015-10-30%20at%2008.46.png?dl=0)

![https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/s0p502ynvqr9dna/2015-10-30%20at%2008.49.png?dl=0](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/s0p502ynvqr9dna/2015-10-30%20at%2008.49.png?dl=0)

That last one is a bit wierd. If it the second letter, `ä` was treated as an `a` it should have been on top of the list.

The swedish alphabet: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swedish_orthography (We are not the only nation using these letters though.)

data.title: The editor has crashed
data.body:
I'm working on a project, both from my mac and my windows (10) pc. 
When pulling the latest code from my repo this morning, and trying to open the folder (or any single file from within the folder for that matter), I get a dialog saying "The editor has crashed". I can either close the window, reload or keep it open - none of them are viable options and the editor keeps crashing. I've tried uninstalling, removing all plugins and themes, installed the beta version, but nothing appears to be working.

data.title: Cursor goes missing, when admin password prompt is triggered for a write protected file during editing
data.body:
1. Using the editor on mac.
2. If a file has write permission restrictions, mac OS prompts for the admin password(sudo) , for editing. But after that the cursor stops showing. I have to switch to some other file and come back to re focus the cursor. Or also switch to some other application and come back. (CMD+TAB)*2.
